mdRecord.dcterms:description: Title and location were notes by the photographer. George Grant Elmslie (February 20, 1869 â€“ April 23, 1952) was an American, though born in Aberdeenshire, Scotland, Prairie School architect whose work is mostly found in the Midwestern United States. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Grant_Elmslie W.H. Healy of Aurora, Il., began an undertaking company and commissioned Elmslie to build a chapel in 1928. It is assumed from the photographer's note that this was a single family dwelling for the Healy's. http://www.memorialsolutions.com/sitemaker/sites/HealyC1/?page=aboutus [work]
